title: With Comey Indictment, Trump Sets Retribution Precedent That Could Haunt His Allies
summary: President Trump’s retribution campaign risks ushering in a cycle of retaliation in which each new administration takes aim at the last one.

title: Trump Raises Possibility of Inquiry Into Wray, Another Former F.B.I. Director
summary: In a phone interview with NBC, Mr. Trump said an investigation of Christopher Wray could be underway, days after the Justice Department’s indictment of James B. Comey.

title: Trump to Meet With Congressional Leaders as Shutdown Deadline Looms
summary: Lawmakers face a Tuesday deadline to fund the government, which will require them to agree on a spending measure that can win at least 60 votes in the Senate.

title: What We Know About the Suspect in the Michigan Church Shooting
summary: The suspect, a 40-year-old man, was killed during the attack, officials said.

title: The Michigan Attack Targeted a Latter-day Saint Church
summary: The building in Grand Blanc Township served a congregation of about 150 members. And that number was growing, according to a frequent visitor.

title: Eric Adams Abandons Re-election Bid for Mayor of New York City
summary: Mayor Adams’s campaign was left foundering after repeated scandals, a federal indictment and his courtship of President Trump.

title: Swaggering, Scandalous, Strange: There Will Never Be Another Eric Adams
summary: The quotable, luxury-loving, perpetually mysterious mayor took New Yorkers on a wild and unpredictable ride.

title: 13 Moments That Have Defined Eric Adams’s Political Career
summary: Mr. Adams served in the New York State Senate and as Brooklyn borough president before becoming mayor of New York City in 2022. Ethical questions have followed him along the way.

title: What the Public Memory of Charlie Kirk Revealed
summary: For those who felt denigrated by his rhetoric, the bipartisan tributes to him as a champion of free speech augured something dangerous: the mainstreaming of formerly extremist views.

title: Bad Bunny Will Headline Super Bowl Halftime Show
summary: The Latin superstar known for hits including “MIA,” “I Like It” and “Me Porto Bonito” will perform in February in Santa Clara, Calif.

title: Venezuela, America and the Specter of Regime Change
summary: In this first edition of The World newsletter, we explore why a president who campaigned against “foreign wars” is sending warships to Venezuela.

title: Q&A: Our New Global Newsletter Host on Creating an ‘Antidote to the Overwhelm’
summary: Katrin Bennhold is the host of The World, a New York Times newsletter for readers around the globe. It launches this week.

title: Missing From a U.N. Meeting on Helping Refugees? The Refugees.
summary: World leaders will discuss how to assist the Rohingya in the world’s largest refugee settlement. But no one living there is attending the conference at the United Nations.

title: Moldova’s Pivotal Election Expected to End in Victory for Pro-Europeans
summary: The party of President Maia Sandu appeared poised to keep its majority in Parliament, in a vote widely seen as a showdown between Europe and Russia.

title: The World’s 50 Best Restaurants in North America
summary: No. 1 on the new ranking is Atomix, a refined Korean tasting-menu spot in New York. But other picks reflect a surprising turn to the casual.

title: I Beat the Anthropic A.I. Chatbot That Stole My Book
summary: A.I. feels like a runaway train. But we don’t have to let it run over us.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coates on Bridging Gaps vs. Drawing Lines
summary: The writer Ta-Nehisi Coates joins Ezra Klein on the show to discuss how the left should think about the work of politics and persuasion in this moment.

title: Stowaway Found Dead in Wheel Well of American Airlines Jet, Police Say
summary: The body was found on Sunday at Charlotte Douglas International Airport in the landing gear compartment of a plane that had recently arrived from Europe, the police said.

title: Viv Prince, Rock’s Original Madman Drummer, Is Dead at 84
summary: A drummer for the 1960s British band the Pretty Things, “the high priest of lunacy” set a high bar for fiery performances and offstage misbehavior.
